Detailed Description

An implementation of the API in qubits.h for a local (non-MPI) environment.

Definition in file qubits_env_local.c.

Function Documentation

REAL calcTotalProbability ( MultiQubit  multiQubit  ) 

Calculate the probability of being in any state by taking the norm of the entire state vector.

Should be equal to 1.

Parameters:
[in] multiQubit object representing a set of qubits
Returns:
total probability

Definition at line 61 of file qubits_env_local.c.

References ComplexArray::imag, MultiQubit::numAmps, ComplexArray::real, REAL, and MultiQubit::stateVec.

00061                                                 {
00062   /* IJB - implemented using Kahan summation for greater accuracy at a slight floating
00063      point operation overhead. For more details see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kahan_summation_algorithm */
00064   /* Don't change the bracketing in this routine! */
00065   REAL pTotal=0; 
00066   REAL y, t, c;
00067   long long int index;
00068   long long int numAmpsPerRank = multiQubit.numAmps;
00069   c = 0.0;
00070   for (index=0; index<numAmpsPerRank; index++){ 
00071     /* Perform pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]; by Kahan */
00072    // pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.real[index];
00073     
00074     y = multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.real[index] - c;
00075     t = pTotal + y;
00076     c = ( t - pTotal ) - y;
00077     pTotal = t;
00078     
00079     /* Perform pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]; by Kahan */
00080     //pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index];
00081     
00082     
00083     y = multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index] - c;
00084     t = pTotal + y;
00085     c = ( t - pTotal ) - y;
00086     pTotal = t;
00087     
00088     
00089   } 
00090   return pTotal;
00091 }

REAL collapseToOutcome ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
const int  measureQubit,
int  outcome 
)

Update the state vector to be consistent with measuring measureQubit=0 or measureQubit=1 according to the value of outcome.

Measure in Zero performs an irreversible change to the state vector: it updates the vector according to the event that an outcome has been measured on the qubit indicated by measureQubit (where his label starts from 0, of course). It achieves this by setting all inconsistent amplitudes to 0 and then renormalising based on the total probability of measuring measureQubit=0 if outcome=0 or measureQubit=1 if outcome=1. It then returns the probability of making this measurement.

Parameters:
[in,out] multiQubit object representing the set of qubits
[in] measureQubit qubit to measure
[in] outcome to measure the probability of and set the state to -- either zero or one
Returns:
probability of qubit measureQubit being either zero or one

Definition at line 195 of file qubits_env_local.c.

References collapseToOutcomeLocal(), findProbabilityOfOutcome(), MultiQubit::numQubits, QuESTAssert(), REAL, and REAL_EPS.

00196 {
00197     QuESTAssert(measureQubit >= 0 && measureQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00198     REAL stateProb;
00199         stateProb = findProbabilityOfOutcome(multiQubit, measureQubit, outcome);
00200     QuESTAssert(fabs(stateProb>REAL_EPS), 8, __func__);
00201     collapseToOutcomeLocal(multiQubit, measureQubit, stateProb, outcome);
00202     return stateProb;
00203 }

void compactUnitary ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
const int  targetQubit,
Complex  alpha,
Complex  beta 
)

Rotate a single qubit in the state vector of probability amplitudes.

Given two complex numbers alpha and beta, applies the operation
[alpha, -beta*
beta, alpha*]

Remarks:
Qubits are zero-based and the the first qubit is the rightmost

alpha, beta must obey |alpha|^2 + |beta|^2 = 1

Parameters:
[in,out] multiQubit object representing the set of qubits
[in] targetQubit qubit to rotate
[in] alpha rotation angle
[in] beta rotation angle

00104     QuESTAssert(validateAlphaBeta(alpha, beta), 6, __func__);
00105 
00106         // all values required to update state vector lie in this rank
00107         compactUnitaryLocal(multiQubit, targetQubit, alpha, beta);
00108 }

void controlledCompactUnitary ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
const int  controlQubit,
const int  targetQubit,
Complex  alpha,
Complex  beta 
)

Rotate a single qubit in the state vector of probability amplitudes.

Given two complex numbers alpha and beta and a control qubit, applies the operation:
[alpha, -beta*
beta, alpha*]
Only when the control qubit is one.

Remarks:
Qubits are zero-based and the the first qubit is the rightmost

alpha, beta must obey |alpha|^2 + |beta|^2 = 1

Parameters:
[in,out] multiQubit object representing the set of qubits
[in] targetQubit qubit to rotate
[in] controlQubit perform rotation if this qubit is 1
[in] alpha rotation angle
[in] beta rotation angle

int measureWithStats ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
int  measureQubit,
REAL *  stateProb 
)

Definition at line 211 of file qubits_env_local.c.

References collapseToOutcomeLocal(), findProbabilityOfOutcome(), genrand_real1(), MultiQubit::numQubits, QuESTAssert(), REAL, and REAL_EPS.

00211                                                                               {
00212     QuESTAssert(measureQubit >= 0 && measureQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00213 
00214     int outcome;
00215     // find probability of qubit being in state 1
00216         REAL stateProbInternal = findProbabilityOfOutcome(multiQubit, measureQubit, 1);
00217 
00218     // we can't collapse to a state that has a probability too close to zero
00219     if (stateProbInternal<REAL_EPS) outcome=0;
00220     else if (1-stateProbInternal<REAL_EPS) outcome=1;
00221     else {
00222         // ok. both P(0) and P(1) are large enough to resolve
00223         // generate random float on [0,1]
00224         float randNum = genrand_real1();
00225         if (randNum<=stateProbInternal) outcome = 1;
00226         else outcome = 0;
00227     } 
00228     if (outcome==0) stateProbInternal = 1-stateProbInternal;
00229     collapseToOutcomeLocal(multiQubit, measureQubit, stateProbInternal, outcome);
00230     *stateProb = stateProbInternal;
00231     return outcome;
00232 }

int syncQuESTSuccess ( int  successCode  ) 

Performs a logical AND on all successCodes held by all processes.

If any one process has a zero successCode all processes will return a zero success code.

Parameters:
[in] env object representing the execution environment. A single instance is used for each program
[in] successCode 1 if process task succeeded, 0 if process task failed
Returns:
1 if all processes succeeded, 0 if any one process failed

Definition at line 36 of file qubits_env_local.c.

00036                                      {
00037         return successCode;
00038 }
